message: Is PHP really dead? Should I drop it for something like Ruby, Python or Node?

data.message: Try node and react.js
Try node bs  I think php will never die, facebook made with php
I would vote for Python <3
i dont think php is dead or it will be any time soon however there are new web technologies taking places
Node seems to be on the rise. But php will never be "dead"
People still use MS Access for databases, DOS programs for management ! there's nothing in IT that is dead !
PHP never die.
PHP dead and buried i vote for "Java  - Scala "

I don't think it's dead, however I think PHP jobs are more about maintaining code, because most old websites are made with PHP, while new projects usually go for newer technologies such as Node/Python/Ruby
Tantawy ðŸ˜‚
you should start consider one of Java/Go/Python/NodeJs
Don't drop it, but it's a good thing to consider different technologies from time to time. Php is still viable so far
Omar Ahmed Barakat
Or update to php7
Yes I would consider learning new language as investment ! Node and Golang for example

PHP and dead in the same phrase? :D :D 
More than 75% of the top websites use PHP as their server side programming language ;)

For example an ancient language like Perl is still "heavily" used and have a good community and complained like booking still use it and widely used in Linux tools (I'm not perl fan )

If u want to compete with developers abroad u have to go with node.js with a web framework like hapi sail express
what is with all this node hype LOL

WordPress Along has 27% of Market share so off course not
https://wptavern.com/wordpress-passes-27-market-share-banks-on-customizer-for-continued-success

PHP is not dead but it's a bad language. And before people start saying JavaScript sucks & stuff like that, on the front-end JavaScript is the *only* choice. On the backend though you have many better options that PHP. 

So I'd recommend to learn something better than PHP, choose whatever you like at the end of the day languages are mostly syntax because programming concepts are 90% of the time, the same.
